De M
r
le Comte d'Essex a M
r
Bodley le 5
me
Juin 1595

page.lettertext:
fol.223r
S
r
, none living saw the Scedule or inclosed paper but
my self, nor none was ever acquainted w
th
the argumen
t
of it, It being instantlie upon the readinge co
m
itted to
the fyer. But y
r
suspition of his cominge to yo
w
is just
for he hath had a desire of that imploiment, and yet
as familiar as he is w
th
me he never would breake it
i
m
ediatlie w
th
my self. But made Lakes the Clerke
of the signet breake it w
th
me by an other 3
d
p
r
son
I answered that I would not wronge one frende to pleasure
an other, I know yf yo
w
went it was a wronge to
have anie man joyned w
th
yo
w
, and yf yo
w
went
not I would neither make nor medle in it. Here
upon I guesse he came to sownde yo
w
whether yo
w
would be content to be joyned or to be excluded for
my constancy if my love towardes yo
w
did not hold [me]
I will never seeke to grace anie man by that
w
ch
yo
w
have w
th
ill satisfacc
o
n given owt
and so I
rest.
Yo
r
most assured frende
